review: This Is My StoryI wish my husband had never been prescribed Xarelto by his cardiologist in 2017. Blood clotting factors were never checked because the makers of this drug do not recommend testing. Now the dosage has been changed but is that going to prevent brain bleeds and death?At 63 years old, his brain bleed started at his desk at work. Air Lifted to hospital and later taken off  vent with no brain activity. -Healthy person with  newly diagnosed aFib.Can anyone answer the following questions?1.  Would it be much of an inconvenience to test patients for clotting  on this medication?  2.  And do cardiologists get benefits when prescribing Xarelto?3.  Has the dosage change reduced deaths from bleeds?  4.  An antidote for this kind of damage is not a solution. Don’t take Xarelto!Widow

Have been taking xarelto 20mg for about 3 years my hair is falling out but the cardiologist will not agree that it is caused by the xarelto.If this hair loss continues I will be bald in the near future.Has anyone had this problem.

I have been on this drug for about 10 months. It seems to be causing some real issues both mentally and physically. I have a problem with localized pain in my shoulder which I didn't injure. I have muscle pain in my legs and arms and muscle weakness. I used to enjoy my long walks but now I don't have the energy or strength. I have bouts of severe itching over different parts of my body i.e , scalp arms, legs, abdomen but no rash.  I am also having bladder control problems.Some days I feel like I'm losing my sanity. Today is one of those days. I got up feeling like I've been run over by a truck. These days are much more frequent. I'm at the end of my rope. I'm going to speak to my Doctor later today but I have to come of this drug. My atrial fib is pretty well controlled with the drugs I've been taking but my quality of life has nose dived with xarelto. Can anyone relate ?

My husband started 20 mg of Xarelto 12/14/10. He had a hemorrhagic stroke 9/28/21 that was fatal from this drug. His cardiologist said that they are seeing more and more brain bleeds with this drug. At least with the older drug, warfarin, regular blood work is done to check on bleeding/clotting. Follow up reviews show that this drug in excess of 10 mg. is causing brain bleeds.

I have been on Xarelto 20mg for the last 2 years.  I have AFIB and I had DVT in my legs.  On my one year anniversary, Xarelto eliminated my DVT in both legs, they were so painful, especially behind my knees.  Xarelto eliminated that crisis.  I've continued the Xarelto for my AFIB along with metoprolol 25mg. 2X a day.  I have not had an AFIB crisis since.  I was in the hospital for my AFIB.  I'm shocked at these people who blame Xarelto for their problems.  It can be many other things like multiple drug interactions.  Or other health issues.   Xarelto saved my life. I buy my medicine out of UAE.  $135.00 for 3 months worth.

I took this drug Xarelto for atrial fibrillation and ended up with side effects of the most painful legs, they felt as if they were on fire.Now my arms are beginning to feel the same pain,I also find great difficulty in controlling my bladder,Never had this before.Has anyone out there had the same experience?

Please do not take this drug, my husband died on this. He had been on Warfarin for 7 years with no problems. Cardiologist swapped him to Xarelto, within 5 months he was coughing up blood, having dizzy spells, aneurysms, lung problems, I could go on. He was convinced it was this drug and the more I read about the more I have to agree . He died in June.

Xarelto is very effective in providing anticoagulant effect. For me that resulted in almost uncontrollable nose bleeds (up to 14 hours) and 3-5 hours for very minor skin scratches. But the worse outcomes were the side effects: consistent headaches; severe shortness of breath; depression;  bad mood (extremely grouchy); stomach aches; and constipation. I do not recommend this medicine to anyone. Warfarin ($6.00/month) is easy to manage and it has almost NO side effect.

Have been on the Xarelto medication five years and had experienced no major issues, just some bleeding with small cuts and some bruising.  Then I developed arm and leg pain and some gum bleeding.  The leg pain started in one thigh and woke me up at night with burning prickling nerve pain and sometimes felt like I had been electrified.  The rest of the thigh was numb.  Soon both legs were involved. My doctor switched me to Eliquis which she said had less side effects and I will soon see if the arm and leg pain disappear.

Used xarelto and it caused A fib. which was the worst thing. Caused my heart to race.  Actually hurt my heart. Took six months for me to return to anything normal in my life. This drug is dangerous. Stay away from it.

I have had a fib and was hospitalized 6 times in 7. Put on Xarelto blood thinner as having a stroke is far worse if you survive it than any side effects.  My father had 11 strokes in 5 years before he died at age 58.  I have had no side effects from this drug.  Had major surgery and was told that I bled less than one tablespoon.  Xarelto has very rapid time frame when stopping the pills before surgery.  It exits your body very rapidly so I find it hard to believe all the symptoms reported after the medication were stopped were caused by this medication. I took my regular one a day pill two nights before major surgery and stopped the pill the night before surgery and restarted the medication one day later per doctors direction.  I have been on this medication for six years because of my a fib and my family history of stroke.  This medication does nothing to cure a fib but it does everything to prevent strokes.  It has a very rapid exit time for leaving your body.

Used Xarelto and it almost killed me. Took drug as prescribed and it caused afib.  First day heart rate jumped to 114 and wouldn’t come down.  Finally came down to 85. Next day heart rate went 120.  Third day 117. I stopped the drug. I was so sick. So weak I could hardly walk. Took three months for me to feel normal after I stopped taking the drug.  This drug is awful

Had a freak 1 time afib event. 54 year old Male. No history of heart issue in family. Rushed to ER with heart rate of 152. Felt weak, sweaty, generally terrible. At ER, heart went back into rhythm, was given xarelto 1 per day 30mg for precaution. Saw dr 6 days later. Felt horrible for every day on this drug. Pain, dizzy.. felt like I was being poisoned. Got worse everyday. If I didn't get off this poison, I would have lost my job, as I could not function! Dr at cardio clinic took me off this drug immediately after stress test came back perfect and all blood work perfect. Been off this now 6 days and almost free of side effects. Still some episodes of anxiety, tired, and dizziness. Started feeling better the next day after stopping. Stay away from this drug at all costs.. I'm wondering if I will ever feel normal again..  I was only on it for a week and wow.. unbelievable..

The med is not meant to help the symptoms of Afib. It is just a blood thinner. All it does is protect your provider if you have a  blood clot anyway. It should decrease the odds of having a blood clot, but as far as making you feel better, absolutely not. Your heart will still be going into afib on a regular basis, you will still feel horrid. And of course as with all of american health care you will become a great cash cow for the American medical industry. There are no cures being developed in the US for Afib, or anything else. Sorry, greed based medicine means they want to make you sicker, not better. I see that now.

Well on Xarelto I didn't have a stroke, but hair fell out a ton. Also short of breath and Ears Started Ringing (tinnitus) and is driving me nuts. Never had a ear issue in my life before this Drug. Been on 1 month after My First A Fib episode.  Doctor said today I can get off it.  70 years old .

One week after starting, I started experiencing almost uncontrollable nose bleeds. I got a small cut on my lower leg that would not heal. Fought with the doctor who was very upset when I stopped taking. It took about two weeks  for the bleeding to subside. I refuse to take this or any similar medication again.

For me everyone of these blood thinners are poison and full of side effects.  I have blood in my stool, shortness of breath rash stomach pain, blood pressure spikes, But hey no stroke, just no life. I've tried a few and they are all poison to me.

81 year old woman  using 20 Xarelto  my side effects are nauseous, urinary issues, severely  bleeding hemorrhoids, every time even with soft movements. Bleeding from vagina post change-of-life, two pints of blood loss, anemic, white spots in mouth, troubles staying asleep, itchy skin, thin skin, weight loss, loss of and changes in appetite.

My cardiologist recommended xarelto because of age (83) and I experienced a fib one time. I started the drug 20mg and on the second day I had a fib and my heart rate was 104 and two days later another a fib with heart rate of 105 and on the fourth day a fib and heart rate at 104 again.  During that time I had extreme fatigue and my feet and ankles swelled up. My knees became very painful and my stomach was upset most of the time. My vision was blurred. My blood pressure rose significantly.  My normal blood pressure is 118/70 and heart rate is normally 64.  Stopped taking drug on my own. My heart rate has returned to normal of 64. Blood pressure is still abnormal for me at 140/80. Ankles and feet swelling has gradually doing better.  Vision is a little better. Stomach is still painful.  For my, this drug is a killer. Stay away from it. It’s a mystery time why doctors prescribe it.

I was on it for about 30 days, I was never told it would cause blood in your urine which it did. Also had trouble peeing and pain in my lower back. Stop taking this drug and everything cleared up in a week. Stay away from this drug.
I suffered four months of awfulness from this drug.

I was started on Xarelto because of Afib. After some time, besides the bruising, the red urine which my cardiologist dismissed as not relevant, I notice the decreasing effect of my seizure medications. I couldn't understand why until I was told about the interaction. I stopped Xarelto.

This drug helps a lot of people. Not me.I believe Xarelto caused four episodes of near fatal GI bleeding over a seven month time frame.  I had been on and off this med for about  a year and a half. I stopped taking it and no more bleeding. I am a 62 year old male.

Been on it about 5 weeks for AF.  Immediately experienced muscle spasms in odd places (side of my head, neck, second knuckle joint, one rib) and as time went on, crippling spasms affecting mobility (feet, legs, shoulders).  Got the doc's OK to go off it tonight, hooray!

First 5 weeks on Xarelto I had explosive diarrhea   A sac of blood formed at the back of mouth and broke while brushing teeth.  I had wondered if the sac was pus signalling abscess, however, after the sac broke and blood flowed, no other problems occurred.  My eyes have sandy substances that I am continually rubbing away, eyes are red, irritated, look tired.  Sometimes I cannot read what is on a computer screen or in a book.  I have tiredness/weakness. Also, headaches/neck aches which are not normal for me.  Will be discussing these at an appointment in July.  I have been on Xarelto for 4 1/2 months.
I experienced  blood urine for 3 weeks.

I have been on Xarelto  for afib for just over 1 year.  Did not experience experience  any side affects until recently I had blood in my urine .  Up to then the degree of afib did not improve.  I am assuming the blood was attributed to kidney stones but I had none of the symptoms, e.g. no pain at all and no difficulty in urinating.  My doctor told me to stop taking the Xarelto immediately, which I did and 6 days later my urine is pale yellow and clear and  assuming it continues to be I'll take my chances and forget about blood thinners.

I have been on xarelto for 7 months. I had bleeding in both eyes the first month, bleeding from Hemmoroids after that and still do. My joints and muscles hurt so bad and its actually hard to walk at times. I have swollen legs , feet and hands. I do know I am overweight and 71 years old but my blood pressure is controlled on meds. I do have afib, but I want off this terrible medication. Doctor told me they are all the same and I need to stay on it. Coumadin made me terribly sick , dizzy and tired.  I am ready to give up and just take natural thinners.

I’ve been on this drug since Sep 2017.  Sometime November 2017, I’ve experiencing some right leg pain, posterior calf and hamstring pain while driving.  I’m very active and still managed to workout almost at least 5 times a week.  The pain subsided late December 2017  but still experiencing the same pain occasionally.  Now  I guess the drug also triggers my BPH.  Any thoughts on this?

I made a comment here a couple of years ago when I had just been put on Xarelto, before that I had been on  Elequis. The side effects were to bad, especially with Xarelto, that I stopped any medication. However, a change in Cardiologist, and I was eventually persuaded to try another, PRADAXA. This one suits me and I have no side affects at all  Xarelto gave me really bad migraines, my head felt as if it was swelling and my eyes popping out. I couldn’t get out of bed most days. I will never forget that. You have to take responsibility for your health.  Always speak to your Doctor first. If your not happy get a second opinion.

Drug works. Thins your blood out! Been on Xarelto for 1 year and quitting it. Have a loop monitor for 6 months and no AFib. One doctor says quit it one says stay on. Some score they use says I can quit so that's what I'm going to do. First six months had some muscle pain but I blamed Lipitor. Started to get blurry vision so eye doctor said everything was fine. Now I'm a year in. I have 2 large bruises on both legs and big toe just recently for really no apparent reason. Nose bleeds almost daily, muscle pain in bicep and upper back with heavy feeling in legs when walking. Shortness of breath comes out of nowhere and lasts less than an hour happens on occasion. Quit and so far muscle pain has subsided.

It killed my beloved mother in July 2014 she was suddenly rushed by ambulance early morning hours. She had several ischemia strokes and had  uncontrollable bleeding after surgery she died to taking xarelto. Now I've been turned down by lawyers because the death report said she died from C.O.P.D. and trying to find another law firm who will take my case the end results are death from this bad drug

My beloved mother went to the hospital by ambulance in 2014. She had afib which  caused her to have ischemic strokes, bloody urine found out later in coffee can. She was in a nightmare for 6 weeks until the early morning hours of July 12th 2014 . They did an abdominal surgery so that the bleeding would stop and they had to cauterise her arteries in her stomach and put a vac pac on her. Then was rejected on the case so far because her death report said she died from COPD can someone help me try to get justice .

My mom has AF and didn't take any blood thinner before. She went to emergency in US and the doctor prescribed this drug to her. She followed the instruction to take the medicine. About 25 days later, she got the brain bleeding and woke up three weeks later after surgery, another two weeks later, she had the second brain bleeding, a few weeks later she passed away.  It took my mom to the heaven. What should I say.
I have episodes of red blood cells in my urine, (colour of red wine). GP has referred me to the urology specialist at General  Hospital. Is this normal after 3 months of taking this meds?

Apparently helps my a-fib, but causes bad bruising and bleeding from minor wounds.  I also have bad heart burn and take antacid frequently. This happens while I'm eating, after, and also when my stomach is empty. A friend who tried Xarelto had the same problem, which makes me think it's from the medicine, or at least it made it worse. This causes me lots of pain and discomfort, but I don't know if another blood thinner would be the same.

While on Xarelto I experienced a stroke.  Partial loss of vision.  I have atrial fibrillation. Initially, a few years ago I was put on Coumadin.  That was a hassle. Then I was very glad when Pradaxa came out and it was prescribed.  But it caused such stomach pain.  I was then put on Xarelto. I took it faithfully as prescribed.  I had no discomfort or side effects, but then in December of 2016 I had the stroke.  Now I am on Eliquis.

Why--Why for goodness sake is the 20 mg "tablet" so bloody small???  It is ridiculous the size and shape of it--if you drop one good luck and get out your magnifying glass to find it!!  Do you have medical engineers to design these things?  If so, this one is a big mistake. I intend to ask my physician for two 10s,  nice round pills these old eyes can see--even if I drop one!

My mother was on these for 9 months. It caused her to have constant, severe diarrhea. Just yesterday she had a major bleed whilst going to the toilet. She had numerous tests on her tummy troubles a few months back and they found nothing wrong. Obviously Dr's prescribed these and couldn't be bothered reading up on the drug. She has been so sick for 6 months. Crazy.
Experience initially- hives which disappeared after a few days- replaced by rash and itching on my ankles and feet which continues. Also woozy and light headedness continues.

My mother is in the hospital now almost on her death bed from Xarelto. It caused her to have a gastrointestinal bleed and she has bloody fluid around her heart which had to be removed and she still has a chest tube for that, I don't recomment anyone to take this drug. It will kill you!

I'm a 50 yr old female who is still menstruating. I started this drug in the hospital and my cycle went from 3-5 days - up to 9 days then stopped.This month- I am on day 15 of an incredibly heavy cycle. I wear TWO extra long overnight pads ( which should last 10 hours) and I go through them in less than 2 hours.I started this drug after a mild stroke that seems to have been a by-product of A-fib . I didn't want Coumadin (aka Rat Poison) - and thought out of the 3 two-year old medicines left, this seemed to be the best for my active lifestyle.   It is not.The bleeding is so heavy, I am exhausted. Pains in my feet adn ankles. Back pains, neck pains and Migraine like headaches on the opposite side of my stroke affected side. HELP!

Light pink bleeding from  my throat and. sores on tongue. Sore. and cramps in feet and legs.pink blood in nose also.Tingling in fingers. Sore arms, stiff neck Stomach pain that goes to my back.Shortness of breath.

After starting Xarelto, I saw no change after a few days so I headed out to my sales territory. I decided to spend the night in Chattanooga.  I urinated before midnight and thought I saw a slight pink tint to my urine. I got up to urinate about 2 hrs later and decided to pee in a cup. Defintely reddish. I used another cup about 4 am and when I got up about 5:30-6am. This time my urine looked like ketchup water......I canceled safety talks and headed home to see my doctor. Defintely had blood in my urine.  He stopped Xaralto.....Back to Coumadin and monitoring.

I have had afib for about 12 years and have had two ablations.  Afib is back again but not all the time.  Had to be electroconverted in late Feb and was put on Eliquus.  My blood pressure went sky high and I started to develop diahrrea.  As it got worse, they agreed to switch me to Xarelto.  After about a week, my diahrrea was out of control and there was blood in the stool.  The doctor told me I had to stay on it but I couldn't take the side effects.  I haven't taken Xarelto for three days.  No more blood in stool.  Diahhrea is clearing up.  Blood pressure down to 119/66.BAD DRUG!!!!!

After being on Coumadin for 1 year I thought I was going to go crazy with all the annoying phone calls from the office about blood testing.  The doctor kept telling me the tests are necessary to prevent me from bleeding out or having another stroke.  I said isn't there something different and he referred me to talk to my PCP who recommended Xarolto and it has changed my life for the better.  I never felt so good and I never have to worry about blood test or diet.  Needless to say that doctor is no longer my doctor

I'm diabetic and it's uncontrollable since taking Xarelto. I'm sure Afib symptoms are gone now so I can't imagine a downside. I'm seeing my neurologist this week to remove me from the medication. I live in Thailand where Xarelto is cheap without insurance.
I have terrible headaches after 2 weeks.   Some are so bad I vomit and have vertigo.  Other days I will have head pain for 12 hours or more.  At least 3 headaches a week now.

In my case, I believe that Xarelto keeps any injury from healing in a timely manner.  A scratch that would normally disappear in a week or two lasts months for healing.  It worries me even though several doctors from different specialities  have said there is no connection here.
Xarelto probably saved my life from a stroke with a fib. I feel great on a high dose....I  adjusted well and feel better than before I started it. I don't fear a stroke anymore with Xarelto.

Bruising is common.  I have lower back soreness and right leg hip area pain.  Some leg weakness in the afternoon and evening.  No reason to stop the medication in my opinion.  I have had kyphoplasty and gall bladder surgery, and the medication was stopped temporarily for both.   No adverse reactions.

I have had no major adverse effects from taking Xarelto.  However, it seems that since starting this, the back of my lower neck itches all the time.  I have scrubbed my neck, I have no rash or appearance of anything unusual, just the itch. Wonder if this medicine could cause this.  I believe I ran across an article of someone complaining of the same condition but I don't know where I saw it.

Since taking Xarelto I have had 3-4 vivid dreams/nightmares  per night that were very work specific-strenuous  and exhausting (not frightening) and I awaken in the morning exhausted from all the effort put forth in the dreams.

Some itching with this but so glad not to go for blood work and to be able to eat whatever I want. Cardiologist put me on this in January as I was on warfarin since Dec 26. This doc does ablations for Atrial fibrillation (and teaches fellows also) and this is what he wanted me to take. Little bruising, minor bleeding when brushing, nothing significant. I also take amiodarone for the Atrial fibrillaiton.
I missed two doses of Xarelto and had a Mini stroke which doctors say came as a result of the missed doses.  You must take this medicine every day. It does not build up in your system over time.

Have been on Xarelto for 9 months.. no real adverse effects.. only confusing thing is I do not bleed when cut.. or bruise when bumped.. I have asked the mfg so many times to explain this.. and no one answers me.. my INR is a (1). When I ask my Doctor, he tells me don't worry it's working.
Moderate to severe pain in my upper stomach every night, and also after various meals.
